author: Adam Owens
title: Wake County leaders propose plan to fight heroin, opioid overdoses :: WRAL.com
text:
Wake County leaders propose plan to fight heroin, opioid overdoses 
Posted 11 minutes ago Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * Are you human? * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters 
Wake County leaders met Monday about a proposed plan to fight local heroin and opioid overdoses. 
Since 2011, the number of heroin deaths in Wake County has jumped more than 400 percent, and opioid deaths are up 127 percent. Preliminary numbers suggest 2016 continued the trend. Wake County EMS officials answer 2 to 3 overdose related calls a day and up 10 calls per day on weekends. 
Health officials are call the increase in overdoses an emerging public health issue and believe it's the tip of the iceberg. After listening to a presentation at a work session this afternoon, one County Commissioner compared the problem to a spreading brush fire. 
The proposed plan includes hiring two new people â€” a nurse and Substance Use Prevention Consultant. There would also be an increase in contracted services for drug prevention and support as well. 
The proposal would cost nearly a million dollars over the next three years. It is expected to go for a vote at the next commissioner's meeting. Credits
